title: What is the role of the telephone in communication today? - Quora

response.answer_text: I understand by “telephone”, you are referring to fixed line PSTN phones. In today's world, Mobile phones are considered as very personal device which owner always carries with them. Where as, PSTN telephone is supposed to be a stationary communication device. Today, especially for Government offices, Banks, Enterprises, Hospitals, Emergency services & SME businesses, PSTN fixed-line phones play a very vital role as majority of people prefers to dial-in a official phone number instead of anybody's personal mobile no. Secondly, except for small shop owners or few Sales persons, no other business owners or employees would like to accept calls on their personal mobile. Thirdly, PSTN land-line telephones are sometimes mandatory for many regulatory requirements. Finally, as Service providers have started offering bundled Wifi Internet service with Landline Telephones, it's role has increased.

A telephone converts sound, typically and most efficiently the human voice, into electronic signals that are transmitted via cables and other communication channels to another telephone which reproduces the sound to the receiving user.
